reviews.negative_feedback: Our room was in the front block, upstairs, and the patio was in the sun in the afternoon,  so too hot to sit on. Is that really a complaint though? It's the only thing I could think of :)
reviews.positive_feedback: wow, what a great guest house. Lovely property,  with lots of green space, trees, flowers and, shade. Only six rooms so it never feels busy. Several hammocks in the common areas, all in shady spots protected from rain. Rooms are simple but comfortable with plenty of space. Small bedside tables  electrical outlets, and small lights  on both sides of the bed were appreciated! The rooms are constructed with high ceilings and  good ventilation, so they stay relatively cool, and cool down quickly in the evening. Nice bathroom, with a good shower. There is a short walk to the beach down a small path, it only takes about three minutes. The Caba√±as are a little bit removed from the center of town, so it's very quiet. But, it's only about four-five minutes to walk to the main "downtown" intersection, or maybe five minutes if you take the beach route. This end of the beach is also quieter, and is green right down to the sand. The common kitchen was small but well equipped and organized, with more than enough plates, bowls, cups, and cutlery for everyone. Our room was in the upstairs of the front block, and even had it's own small patio with a hammock - perfect for morning coffee!

reviews.title: Bien
reviews.date: Fecha del comentario: 11 de mayo de 2023
reviews.positive_feedback:
The room we stayed in had good amenities like air-conditioning, it wasn't too loud and was clean enough. However, I didn't realise it was a homestay..you are renting a room inside of a family's house, which means the communal areas feels claustrophobic and loud unlike other hostels. So considering that, it's quite over priced for what it is. 
However there are some pros- it's secure, filtered water is available, the family is friendly and helpful and there is air-conditioning. But in terms of ambience and space, It's not the most comfortable. Location is also far from the main areas in ayampe. I'd rate it well for practicality but low for a relaxing stay, purely because you're staying in an extended family's house and you can hear loud conversations and phone sounds from your bedroom.
